meanings.definition: In a loyal or faithful manner.
meanings.sent1: She always followed her friend leally.
meanings.sent2: The dog wagged its tail leally when its owner returned home.
meanings.sent3: The cat leally waited by the door for its owner to come back.
meanings.sent4: The soldier leally stood by his comrade in times of need.
meanings.sent5: The child leally kept their promise to always share their toys.

meanings.sent1: The judge made a leally decision based on the evidence presented.
meanings.sent2: It is important to always act leally and ethically in business.
meanings.sent3: The leally parking attendant made sure all cars were parked correctly.
meanings.sent4: The leally signed contract ensured both parties were protected.
meanings.sent5: The leally executed will distributed the assets fairly among the heirs.
